meanings.definition: Harm the good reputation of (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: The false rumors aimed to discredit her achievements.
meanings.sent2: The journalist tried to discredit the politician's integrity.
meanings.sent3: The silly attempt to discredit the superhero's powers only made people laugh.
meanings.sent4: The dark shadow of doubt tried to discredit the bright light of truth.
meanings.sent5: The stain of discredit on his name was hard to wash away.

meanings.definition: Loss or lack of belief or confidence in someone or something
meanings.sent1: The scandal caused a great discredit to the company's image.
meanings.sent2: His constant lies led to the discredit of his words.
meanings.sent3: The cat's disbelief in the dog's ability to catch a ball was a funny discredit.
meanings.sent4: The storm of doubt brought a heavy discredit upon the once trusted leader.
meanings.sent5: The sudden discredit in the product's quality shocked the customers.
